strategy: Use CatBoost with these settings: iterations=600, learning_rate=0.025, depth=6. For preprocessing, fill numeric NaN with the median, drop columns with more than 50% missing values, and pass categorical features directly to CatBoost using the cat_features parameter. Ensure all categorical features are cast to string before fitting the model.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from catboost import CatBoostRegressor

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_val = validation.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_val = validation['SalePrice']
X_test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Cast categorical columns to string
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].astype(str)
    X_val[col] = X_val[col].astype(str)
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].astype(str)

# Fill numeric NaN with median
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
for col in numeric_columns:
    if col not in ['Id']:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].median())
        X_val[col] = X_val[col].fillna(X_val[col].median())
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna(X_test[col].median())

# Drop columns with more than 50% missing values
missing_ratio = X_train.isnull().mean()
cols_to_drop = missing_ratio[missing_ratio > 0.5].index.tolist()
X_train = X_train.drop(cols_to_drop, axis=1)
X_val = X_val.drop(cols_to_drop, axis=1)
X_test = X_test.drop(cols_to_drop, axis=1)

# Identify categorical columns for CatBoost
cat_features = categorical_columns

# Initialize and train CatBoost model with tuned hyperparameters
model = CatBoostRegressor(
    iterations=600,
    learning_rate=0.025,
    depth=6,
    verbose=False
)
model.fit(X_train, y_train, cat_features=cat_features)

# Predict on test set
y_pred_test = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_pred_test
})

# Save submission
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
